  • sklearn_quantile.RandomForestMaximumRegressor
  • View page source

sklearn_quantile.RandomForestMaximumRegressor

class sklearn_quantile.RandomForestMaximumRegressor(n_estimators=100, *, criterion='squared_error', max_depth=None, min_samples_split=2, min_samples_leaf=1, min_weight_fraction_leaf=0.0, max_features='auto', max_leaf_nodes=None, min_impurity_decrease=0.0, bootstrap=True, oob_score=False, n_jobs=None, random_state=None, verbose=0, warm_start=False, ccp_alpha=0.0, max_samples=None)

fit and predict functions for forest maximum regressors (quantile 1). Implementation based on original paper of Meinshausen (2006).

__init__(n_estimators=100, *, criterion='squared_error', max_depth=None, min_samples_split=2, min_samples_leaf=1, min_weight_fraction_leaf=0.0, max_features='auto', max_leaf_nodes=None, min_impurity_decrease=0.0, bootstrap=True, oob_score=False, n_jobs=None, random_state=None, verbose=0, warm_start=False, ccp_alpha=0.0, max_samples=None)

Methods

__init__([n_estimators, criterion, ...])

apply(X)

Apply trees in the forest to X, return leaf indices.

decision_path(X)

Return the decision path in the forest.

fit(X, y[, sample_weight])

Build a forest of trees from the training set (X, y).

get_params([deep])

Get parameters for this estimator.

predict(X)

predition, based on the predict function of ForestRegressor

score(X, y[, sample_weight])

Return the coefficient of determination of the prediction.

set_params(**params)

Set the parameters of this estimator.

Attributes

feature_importances_

The impurity-based feature importances.

n_features_

Attribute n_features_ was deprecated in version 1.0 and will be removed in 1.2.
